Utilities for manipulating XPS data.

Exports:

XPSExperiment: a container for simulated and experimental xps observables.

Example

Say you have a normal setup with a species manager, species x, y, and some experimental data in a pd.Series. The following is preferred:

xps = XPSExperiment({x: 2.1, y: 3.4}, sm, experimental=experimental_data,

gas_interval=(-1, 0), scale_factor=0.1)

xps.plot()

but is equivalent to the following, which resamples with each assignment:

xps = XPSExperiment({x: 2.1, y: 3.4}, sm) xps.experimental = experimental_data xps.gas_interval = (-1, 0) xps.scale_factor = 0.1 xps.plot()

class lblcrn.experiments.xps.XPSExperiment(species_concs: Dict[sympy.core.symbol.Symbol, float], species_manager: lblcrn.crn_sym.species.SpeciesManager, autoresample: bool = True, autoscale: bool = True, experimental: pandas.core.series.Series = None, gas_interval: Tuple[float, float] = None, scale_factor: float = 0.0, title: str = '')¶

A container for a simulated observable of an XPS experiment.

autoresample¶

Defaults to true, decides if it resamples on edits.

autoscale¶

Defaults to true, decides if it will automatically scale the gaussians and envelope to match the experimental data.

species_concs¶

The concentrations of each species, for the creation of simulated data.

species_manager¶

The SpeciesManager in use.

as_dict() → dict¶

Return a MSON-serializable dict representation.

del_experimental()¶

Deletes experimental, prompting an autoresample..

del_gas_interval()¶

Deletes the gas interval, prompting a resample.

del_scale_factor()¶

Deletes the scale factor, enabling autoscale and prompting an autoresample.

property experimental¶

The experimental data. Might be None.

classmethod from_dict(d: dict)¶

Load from a dict representation.

property gas_interval¶

The interval in which the gas phase peak should be. May be None.

resample(overwrite=True, species=None, ignore=None) → lblcrn.experiments.xps.XPSObservable¶

Recalculates the dataframe in case anything updated.

Parameters

  • overwrite – If true, overwrites self.df with the resampled df.

  • species – A list of sym.Symbols, if you only want to sample for those species.

  • ignore – A list of sym.Symbols to not include.

Returns

An XPSObservable with the resampled data.

property scale_factor¶

The factor by which to scale the simulated data.

set_experimental(experimental: pandas.core.series.Series)¶

Set the experimental data, prompting an autoresample.

set_gas_interval(lower: float, upper: float)¶

Sets the interval in which the gas phase peak should be.

Give bounds for where the _peak_ is: if your bounds are too broad, it will get greedy, as it assumes that that interval is dominated by the gas phase. You can make lower equal to upper if you know the peak.

Parameters

  • lower – float, the lower bound.

  • upper – float, the upper bound.

set_scale_factor(factor: float)¶

Sets the scale factor, disabling autoscale and prompting an autoresample.

property species¶

Give the species’ symbols in this solution.

class lblcrn.experiments.xps.XPSObservable(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, title: str = '')¶

A wrapper around a dataframe, formatted to act like an XPS observable.

df¶

The pandas DataFrame in which the observables are stored.

title¶

A str used for the title during plotting.

property envelope¶

The simulated envelope, the sum of all species’ gaussians.

envelope_integral()¶
property experimental¶

The experimental data. Might be None.

property gas_phase¶

The gas phase part of the spectrum. Might be None.

property gaussians¶

The gaussians of the XPS observable.

integral_diff_between()¶
integral_diff_inside_experimental()¶
integral_diff_outside_experimental()¶
mae()¶
plot(ax: matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes, **kwargs)¶

Plot the XPS observable.

Parameters

  • ax – The plt.Axes on which to plot.

  • **kwargs – Forwarded.

rmse()¶
property x_range¶

The x-values, energies, on which there is data.

lblcrn.experiments.xps.simulate_xps(rsys: lblcrn.crn_sym.reaction.RxnSystem, time: float = 1, species: List[sympy.core.symbol.Symbol] = None, ignore: List[sympy.core.symbol.Symbol] = None, autoresample: bool = True, autoscale: bool = True, experimental: pandas.core.series.Series = None, gas_interval: Tuple[float, float] = None, scale_factor: float = 0.0, title: str = '', **options) → lblcrn.experiments.xps.XPSExperiment¶

Simulate the given reaction system over time.

Parameters

  • rsys – ReactionsSystem, the reaction system to simulate

  • time – The time until which to simulate.

  • species – The species to include in the XPS.

  • ignore – The species to not include in the XPS.

  • autoresample – Decides if the XPS resamples on edits.

  • autoscale – Decides if the XPS will automatically scale the gaussians and envelope to match the experimental data.

  • experimental – The experimental value of the XPS.

  • gas_interval – The interval in which the peak of the gas phase is in the XPS.

  • scale_factor – The scale factor by which to scale the simulated gaussians in the XPS.

  • title – The name to give the XPS, used in plotting.

  • **options – Forwarded to scipy.integrate.solve_ivp

Returns

A Solution object describing the solution.
